scope: Lofi-themed styling: Tailwind setup, dark/warm palette, typography, and visual consistency.
Parameter controls layout: grouping, labels, spacing, Generate button prominence, and hover/focus states.
Playback section: Play/Pause buttons, seek slider, loading indicator, and error UI styling.
Regression: all existing Vitest tests must pass after styling changes.
Typecheck and lint (ESLint, Prettier) for the modified codebase.
environmentData: Node.js runtime with bun; run tests with `bun test` (Vitest).
Browser or jsdom environment for component tests that assert DOM structure and classes.
No backend or DB; no fixtures required beyond existing test setup.
Tailwind build pipeline (Vite/PostCSS) must be in place so utility classes are available in tests where components are rendered.
## User Story: US-001 - Lofi-Themed Color Palette and Typography

automatedTests.description: Verify Tailwind CSS is listed in package.json and tailwind.config file exists
Verify entry CSS (e.g. main.css or index.css) imports Tailwind directives
Verify root/App container uses dark warm background utility classes
Verify headings and body text use lofi-appropriate font classes
Run typecheck and lint on the project
Verify Mood, Tempo, and Style controls are each in a labelled section/card
Verify Generate button exists and has accent/prominent styling classes
Verify interactive elements (button, sliders, selects) are focusable and have focus-visible styling
Verify Play and Pause buttons are rendered with styled classes
Verify seek slider is present and has theme-related styling (track/thumb)
Verify loading state shows a styled indicator (e.g. spinner/skeleton), not raw text only
Verify error state shows a styled alert/banner
Run full Vitest test suite and ensure all tests pass

exploratoryManualTests.description: Visual verification of contrast and lofi aesthetic in browser
Visual verification of layout, spacing, and button prominence in browser
Visual verification of playback section polish and theme consistency in browser
